PiKwonDo package¶

Submodules¶

gui module gpio_scanner module ————————

Classes for front-end display and screen-based input.

class gui.FrontEndController(main)¶

Bases: object

Central QT window manager for all GUI elements.

show()¶

Show the window.

update_ui()¶

Redraw all elements of GUI that may change during use.

class gui.LatestValueBoxIOQT(value=None)¶

Bases: object

A container which holds only the most recent object put in it.

The container provides threadsafe object storage and retrieval. Object get and place functions are pure python. The container instance emits a qt signal when a new object is placed in the container.

get()¶

Retrieve the latest object from the container.

Returns:The object placed in the container.
put(value)¶

Place an object in the container.

Parameters:value – Object to place in the container.
qt_signal¶

Draw the current scores on the screen.

Scan hardware status for buttons and emit correct signal.

class gpio_scanner.BitDecoder(pikwondo)¶

Bases: object

Correlate button press events to signals to emit.

Return pin change signal array, or calculate it.

class gpio_scanner.ButtonHandler(pin, func, edge='both')¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Detect desired signal from GPIO pin and emits signal after debounce.

glitch_done(*args)¶

Emit assigned signal when valid signal detected.

class gpio_scanner.HardwareConfiguration¶

Bases: object

Configure pins for each generation of hardware.

set_pinout()¶

Assign pins to circuit expectations.

setup_gpio()¶

Set GPIO pin numbering scheme and pin initialization.

class gpio_scanner.HardwareControllerScanner¶

Bases: object

Monitor hardware status by regular sweep scans.

load_data()¶

Load data into shift registers.

pin_change_signals¶

Return array of button_signal-signal matrix.

read_bits()¶

Read one bit from each data input pin.

scan_bits()¶

Read all data from controllers.

shift_data()¶

Cycle the clock pin on each controller.

step()¶

Cycle bit scanning and detects changes.

class gpio_scanner.PeriodicActionThread(function, period)¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Perform an action on a regular repeating schedule.

step()¶

Perform desired action in thread-safe way.

gpio_scanner.compare_bits(olds, news)¶

Subtract 2D list to determine changes to bit state.

gpio_scanner.initialize_pins(pins, pin_type='output')¶

Set pinmode for list of GPIO pin numbers.

gpio_scanner.is_nonzero(delta)¶

Return True if any element of 2D list is nonzero.

gpio_scanner.milliseconds(duration)¶

Delay for desired number of milliseconds.

gpio_scanner.pulse_gpio_pin(pin)¶

Set a gpio pin high and low, with appropriate delay.
